alert.note: Alert for Custer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 6:27PM MDT until August 08 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL CUSTER COUNTY... At 627 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have diminished over the warned area. Doppler radar estimates between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen over the past hour, with flash flooding ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Custer County. This includes the following streams and drainages... Alvarado Creek, Grape Creek and Brush Hollow Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
